name: Information Architecture Example: Franchise Food Chain WebSite
description:
A detailed method for representing the content and navigation in a website.

The document may also be considered as a "blueprint", or can be used as a low-fidelity prototype.

The elements that are repeatedly available on every page is shown in as the "top-level page". Actually, the top-level page has no unique content and do not exist in the website, but its elements are on every page. It is called "top-level", because the users may start browsing a modern website from almost any page of the site.

Current diagram shows the content and navigation of an imaginary franchise fast food business located in Turkey, with a lot of brunches in different cities. There are three types of different sales points regarding their sizes.
